queries.query_name: Non Kube System Pod With Host Mount
queries.description: A non kube-system workload should not have hostPath mounted

files.actual_value: Resource name 'release-name-node-exporter' of kind 'DaemonSet' in non kube-system namespace 'default' has a hostPath '/proc' mounted

queries.description: Roles and ClusterRoles with wildcard RBAC permissions provide excessive rights to the Kubernetes API and should be avoided. The principle of least privilege recommends to specify only the set of needed objects and actions

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-logiq-flash}}.rules[2].verbs should list the minimal set of needed objects or actions
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-logiq-flash}}.rules[2].verbs uses wildcards to specify objects or actions

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-prometheus-operator}}.rules[3].verbs should list the minimal set of needed objects or actions
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-prometheus-operator}}.rules[3].verbs uses wildcards to specify objects or actions

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-prometheus-operator}}.rules[4].verbs should list the minimal set of needed objects or actions
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-prometheus-operator}}.rules[4].verbs uses wildcards to specify objects or actions

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-logiq-flash}}.rules[3].verbs should list the minimal set of needed objects or actions
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-logiq-flash}}.rules[3].verbs uses wildcards to specify objects or actions

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-prometheus-operator}}.rules[2].verbs should list the minimal set of needed objects or actions
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-prometheus-operator}}.rules[2].verbs uses wildcards to specify objects or actions

queries.description: Containers should only run as non-root user. This limits the exploitability of security misconfigurations and restricts an attacker's possibilities in case of compromise

metadata.name={{redis-slave}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{metrics}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true

queries.description: Memory limits should be defined for each container. This prevents potential resource exhaustion by ensuring that containers consume not more than the designated amount of memory
Memory requests should be defined for each container. This allows the kubelet to reserve the requested amount of system resources and prevents over-provisioning on individual nodes
Containers should drop 'ALL' or at least 'NET_RAW' capabilities
The permission to create pods in a cluster should be restricted because it allows privilege escalation.

files.expected_value: metadata.name=release-name-logiq-flash.rules.verbs should not contain the value 'create' when metadata.name=release-name-logiq-flash.rules.resources contains the value 'pods'
files.actual_value: metadata.name=release-name-logiq-flash.rules.verbs contains the value 'create' and metadata.name=release-name-logiq-flash.rules.resources contains the value 'pods'

files.expected_value: metadata.name=release-name-logiq-flash.rules.verbs should not contain a wildcard value when metadata.name=release-name-logiq-flash.rules.resources contains the value 'pods'
files.actual_value: metadata.name=release-name-logiq-flash.rules.verbs contains a wildcard value and metadata.name=release-name-logiq-flash.rules.resources contains the value 'pods'

queries.query_name: RBAC Roles with Read Secrets Permissions
queries.description: Roles and ClusterRoles with get/watch/list RBAC permissions on Kubernetes secrets are dangerous and should be avoided. In case of compromise, attackers could abuse these roles to access sensitive data, such as passwords, tokens and keys

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-kube-state-metrics}}.rules[21] should not be granted read access to Secrets objects
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-kube-state-metrics}}.rules[21] is granted read access (verbs: list, watch) to Secrets objects

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-logiq-flash}}.rules[6] should not be granted read access to Secrets objects
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-logiq-flash}}.rules[6] is granted read access (verbs: get, list, watch, create, delete, patch, update) to Secrets objects

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-kubernetes-ingress}}.rules[0] should not be granted read access to Secrets objects
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-kubernetes-ingress}}.rules[0] is granted read access (verbs: list, watch, update) to Secrets objects

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-kubernetes-ingress}}.rules[1] should not be granted read access to Secrets objects
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-kubernetes-ingress}}.rules[1] is granted read access (verbs: get, list, watch) to Secrets objects

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{s3-gateway-update-prometheus-secret}}.rules[0] should not be granted read access to Secrets objects
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{s3-gateway-update-prometheus-secret}}.rules[0] is granted read access (verbs: get, create, update, patch) to Secrets objects

queries.description: CPU limits should be set because if the system has CPU time free, a container is guaranteed to be allocated as much CPU as it requests
CPU requests should be set to ensure the sum of the resource requests of the scheduled Containers is less than the capacity of the node
Deployments should be assigned with a PodDisruptionBudget to ensure high availability

files.actual_value: metadata.name=release-name-kubernetes-ingress-default-backend is not targeted by a PodDisruptionBudget
metadata.name=release-name-kubernetes-ingress is not targeted by a PodDisruptionBudget

queries.query_name: Object Is Using A Deprecated API Version
queries.description: Kubernetes APIs evolve over time and are sometimes removed with newer releases. To prevent incompatibilities when upgrading Kubernetes, deprecated APIs should be replaced with newer and more stable API versions.

files.actual_value: metadata.name={{s3-gateway}}.apiVersion of StatefulSet  is deprecated and is {{apps/v1beta2}}

queries.description: Service type should not be NodePort
Check if StatefulSet resources don't have a podAntiAffinity policy, which prevents multiple pods from being scheduled on the same node.
A StatefulSet requests volume storage.
StatefulSets should be assigned with a PodDisruptionBudget to ensure high availability
